instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Graphic crashes with wired shapes.
threads.message:
Hi 

I have this MacBook board is very clean and no liquid damaged.

Wired graphic crashes.


Can boot to OSX. tried with external monitor same issue with external monitor as well.
Boot with iGPU and no crashing with integrated GPU. works fine.
with above symptoms assuming Gmux is fine Tried to reflow the GPU still same.

Should I replace the GPU?
 or do you think it is something else?

Appreciate your advice.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Graphic crashes with wired shapes.
threads.message: Try first to resolder <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> with leaded solder...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Graphic crashes with wired shapes.
threads.message:
Hi thank you for your advice.
Resolder <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>, still same issue. Replace <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> with known good one , still same issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Graphic crashes with wired shapes.
threads.message: Then the GPU is the problem...
